PARAGRAPH.STRING: (Devanagari: अशोक(:); IAST transliteration: [IAST: Aśoka(ḥ)], pronunciation: [IPA: [aɕoːkə(hə)]]) (304 BC-232 BC) (Imperial Title: "Devanampiya Piyadassi" ie "He who is the beloved of the Gods who, in turn is his loving servant") was the ruler of the Maurya Empire from 273 BC to 232 BC. After a number of military conquests,
reigned over most of South Asia and beyond, from present-day Afghanistan and parts of Persia in the west, to Bengal and Assam in the east, and as far south as Mysore. A later convert to Buddhism,
established monuments marking several significant sites in the life of Shakyamuni Buddha, and according to Buddhist tradition
was closely involved in the preservation and transmission of Buddhism.
